intro: Monoon canangioides, commonly known as the white sand tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its smooth, pale bark and large, palmate leaves that are typically 30–50 cm in diameter. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by woody, spherical fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
